intro: Anacyclus clavatus, commonly known as the clustered fleabane, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy, branched stems and narrow, gray-green leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Anacyclus clavatus is adapted to thrive in poor soils and is often found in disturbed habitats.
